items.title: When will the Oscars give comedies proper recognition?
items.excerpt: If there’s one genre that just doesn’t get enough love at the Academy Awards, it’s horror . But if we had to pick another, it’s comedy, which is widely ignored at the Oscars despite being one of the most challenging genres to master. They have such a hard time being recognized…

items.title: Top 10 Anime Films of All Time
items.excerpt: As Haruo Sotozaki and Hikaru Kondô’s Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle arrives at the North American box office to an astonishing $70 million debut , shortly after Yu Yang’s Ne Zha 2 became the highest-grossing animated film ever with $2.2 billion worldwide, it’s crystal clear tha…

items.title: Matt Fraction’s Batman #1 sells 500,000 copies
items.excerpt: Whether through film, television or ink, when the Bat-Signal is turned on, people will come. And that’s the case with the latest endeavor, Batman #1 , which is being marked as the best-selling comic of the year, with 500,000 copies sold.

items.title: Is the Ballerina 4K Worth Picking Up?
items.excerpt: Ballerina was released earlier this year and didn’t make quite as big of an impact as t he John Wick series, from which it’s spun off, but it was still an enjoyable enough time. I was lucky enough to get sent a 4K Ultra HD Blu-Ray from Lionsgate, so I took a look at some of th…

items.title: Cult Classics That Were Box Office Bombs
items.excerpt: Not every movie can be a box office success. With so many films released year-round, there will inevitably be winners and losers. However, the truly great films go on to become something even bigger than a box office draw: bona fide cult classics. People discover films somewhe…
